text:
Question 171) In the last five years, 32,000 women aged 20 to 24 have been admitted to SUS hospitals because of stroke. Among men of the same age group, there were 28,000 hospitalizations for the same reason.
Suppose, in the next five years, there is an increase of 8,000 hospitalizations of women and that the addition of hospitalizations of men per stroke occurs in the same proportion.
According to the information given, the number of men who would be admitted by stroke over the next five years would correspond to
A) 4 thousand.
B) 9 thousand.
C) 21 thousand.
D) 35 thousand.
E) 39 thousand.
